SEARCH
Package com.dua3.meja.ui

Class SheetViewDelegate

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.meja.ui.SheetViewDelegate
All Implemented Interfaces:
Flow.Subscriber<SheetEvent>
Direct Known Subclasses:
FxSheetViewDelegate, SwingSheetViewDelegate
public abstract class SheetViewDelegate extends Object implements Flow.Subscriber<SheetEvent>
A delegate that combines basic data and functionality for SheetView implementations.

A delegate is used instead of an abstract base class because user interface components might have to be derived from existing UI classes.

  • Field Summary

  • Field Details

    • DEFAULT_SELECTION_STROKE_WIDTH

      public static final int DEFAULT_SELECTION_STROKE_WIDTH
      The default stroke width used for selection outlines in graphical components or UI elements. This value defines the thickness of the border drawn to indicate selection, measured in pixels.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • SheetViewDelegate

      protected SheetViewDelegate(Sheet sheet, SheetView owner)
      Creates a new SheetViewDelegate instance. This delegate handles the common functionality for different sheet view implementations. It initializes the view with the owner's display scale, updates the layout, and subscribes to sheet events to receive notifications of changes.
      Parameters:
      sheet - the sheet model to be displayed and managed
      owner - the sheet view component that owns this delegate

  • Method Details

    • updateLayout

      public void updateLayout()
      Updates the layout calculations for the entire sheet view. This method is called when the layout is marked as changed and performs the following: - Updates pixel-to-point conversion ratios based on current scale - Calculates cumulative row positions and total sheet height - Calculates cumulative column positions and total sheet width - Computes row label width based on the maximum row number width - Computes column label height based on font metrics

      If the layout hasn't changed since the last update, the method returns early to avoid unnecessary recalculations.

    • writeLock

      public com.dua3.utility.concurrent.AutoLock writeLock(String name)
      Acquires a write lock on the sheet and returns an AutoLock instance that manages the lock with an associated description.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the lock
      Returns:
      an AutoLock instance that wraps the write lock of the sheet and provides a textual description of the lock, including the sheet name.

    • getLabelFont

      public com.dua3.utility.text.Font getLabelFont()
      Gets the font used for rendering row and column labels in the sheet view. This font determines the appearance of row numbers and column letters in the sheet's header areas.
      Returns:
      the current font used for row and column labels

    • setLabelFont

      public void setLabelFont(com.dua3.utility.text.Font labelFont)
      Sets the font to be used for rendering row and column labels in the sheet view. Changing this font affects the appearance of row numbers and column letters, and may also affect the layout dimensions of the header areas.
      Parameters:
      labelFont - the new font to use for row and column labels. Must not be null.

    • readLock

      public com.dua3.utility.concurrent.AutoLock readLock(String name)
      Acquires an automatic read lock on the underlying sheet, ensuring the lock is held while the returned AutoLock instance is in use, and releases it automatically when the instance is closed.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the lock
      Returns:
      an AutoLock instance representing the read lock on the sheet

    • update

      public void update(int dpi)
      Updates the view's display settings based on the provided DPI (dots per inch). This method performs a complete update of the view, including: - Adjusting the display and zoom scales for the new DPI - Updating row and column counts - Updating split positions - Recalculating the layout
      Parameters:
      dpi - the new dots per inch value for the display

    • getSheetWidthInPixels

      public float getSheetWidthInPixels()
      Gets the total width of the sheet in pixels. This is calculated by applying the current pixel-to-point ratio to the point-based width. The value changes when the display DPI changes.
      Returns:
      the width of the sheet in pixels

    • getSheetWidthInPoints

      public float getSheetWidthInPoints()
      Gets the total width of the sheet in points (1/72 inch). This represents the logical width of the sheet content, excluding headers and other decorations.
      Returns:
      the width of the sheet in points

    • getSheetHeightInPixels

      public float getSheetHeightInPixels()
      Gets the total height of the sheet in pixels. This is calculated by applying the current pixel-to-point ratio to the point-based height. The value changes when the display DPI changes.
      Returns:
      the height of the sheet in pixels

    • getSheetHeightInPoints

      public float getSheetHeightInPoints()
      Gets the total height of the sheet in points (1/72 inch). This represents the logical height of the sheet content, excluding headers and other decorations.
      Returns:
      the height of the sheet represented in points

    • getSplitXInPoints

      public float getSplitXInPoints()
      Gets the x-coordinate of the vertical split line in points (1/72 inch). This coordinate is calculated as the left edge position of the split column.
      Returns:
      dx coordinate of split, measured from the left edge of the sheet

    • getColumnPos

      public float getColumnPos(int j)
      Get the x-coordinate (in points) of the left edge of the specified column.
      Parameters:
      j - the column number (0-based)
      Returns:
      the x-coordinate in points. For column numbers beyond the last column, the position is calculated by extrapolating using the default column width. Negative column numbers are clamped to 0.

    • getSplitColumn

      public int getSplitColumn()
      Gets the column number where the sheet is vertically split. The split column divides the sheet into left and right panes.
      Returns:
      the column number (0-based) where the vertical split occurs

    • getDefaultColumnWidthInPoints

      public float getDefaultColumnWidthInPoints()
      Gets the default width for columns in points (1/72 inch). This value is used for new columns and for columns beyond the sheet bounds. Delegates to the underlying sheet's default column width setting.
      Returns:
      the default column width in points

    • setSplitColumn

      public void setSplitColumn(int j)
      Sets the column where the sheet should be vertically split. If the split position changes, triggers a layout update. The method is thread-safe and uses a write lock to ensure proper synchronization.
      Parameters:
      j - the column number (0-based) where the vertical split should occur

    • getSplitYInPoints

      public float getSplitYInPoints()
      Gets the y-coordinate of the horizontal split line in points (1/72 inch). This coordinate is calculated as the top edge position of the split row.
      Returns:
      dy coordinate of split, measured from the top edge of the sheet

    • getRowPos

      public float getRowPos(int i)
      Get the y-coordinate (in points) of the top edge of the specified row.
      Parameters:
      i - the row number (0-based)
      Returns:
      the y-coordinate in points. For row numbers beyond the last row, the position is calculated by extrapolating using the default row height. Negative row numbers are clamped to 0.

    • getSplitRow

      public int getSplitRow()
      Gets the row number where the sheet is horizontally split. The split row divides the sheet into upper and lower panes.
      Returns:
      the row number (0-based) where the horizontal split occurs

    • getDefaultRowHeightInPoints

      public float getDefaultRowHeightInPoints()
      Gets the default height for rows in points (1/72 inch). This value is used for new rows and for rows beyond the sheet bounds. Delegates to the underlying sheet's default row height setting.
      Returns:
      the default row height in points

    • setSplitRow

      public void setSplitRow(int i)
      Sets the row where the sheet should be horizontally split. If the split position changes, triggers a layout update. The method is thread-safe and uses a write lock to ensure proper synchronization.
      Parameters:
      i - the row number (0-based) where the horizontal split should occur

    • getSelectionColor

      protected com.dua3.utility.data.Color getSelectionColor()

      Returns:
      the Color instance representing the selection highlight color

      protected void setSelectionColor(com.dua3.utility.data.Color selectionColor)
      Sets the color used to indicate the selection in the sheet view.
      Parameters:
      selectionColor - the Color to be used for the selection highlight

    • getSelectionStrokeWidth

      public float getSelectionStrokeWidth()
      Retrieves the stroke width used for the selection outline.
      Returns:
      the stroke width of the selection rectangle as a floating-point value

    • setSelectionStrokeWidth

      public void setSelectionStrokeWidth(float selectionStrokeWidth)
      Sets the stroke width of the selection.
      Parameters:
      selectionStrokeWidth - the width of the stroke to be used for selection, specified as a float value.

    • getColumnCount

      public int getColumnCount()
      Get number of columns for the currently loaded sheet.
      Returns:
      number of columns

    • getCellAt

      public Cell getCellAt(float x, float y)
      Gets the cell at the specified coordinates in the sheet.
      Parameters:
      x - x-coordinate in points from the left edge of the sheet
      y - y-coordinate in points from the top edge of the sheet
      Returns:
      the cell at the specified coordinates. If the coordinates are outside the sheet bounds, returns the cell at the nearest valid position as the coordinates are not clipped to the sheet bounds

    • getRowNumberFromY

      public int getRowNumberFromY(float y, boolean clipToSheet)
      Get the row number that the given dy-coordinate belongs to.
      Parameters:
      y - dy-coordinate
      clipToSheet - if true, restrict the returned row number to the current maximum row number, otherwise calculate the row number based on the assumption that missing rows all have the default row height
      Returns:
      • -1, if the first row is displayed below the given coordinate
      • number of rows, if the lower edge of the last row is displayed above the given coordinate
      • the number of the row that belongs to the given coordinate

    • getColumnNumberFromX

      public int getColumnNumberFromX(float x, boolean clipToSheet)
      Get the column number that corresponds to the given x-coordinate in points.
      Parameters:
      x - x-coordinate in points from the left edge of the sheet
      clipToSheet - if true, the returned column number will be clipped to the existing column range; if false, the method will extrapolate beyond the last column using the default column width
      Returns:
      the column number where:
      • -1: if the coordinate is to the left of the first column
      • number of columns: if the coordinate is to the right of the last column (only when clipToSheet is false)
      • 0 to (number of columns - 1): the column number containing the coordinate

    • getRowCount

      public int getRowCount()
      Get the number of rows for the currently loaded sheet.
      Returns:
      number of rows

    • getColumnName

      public String getColumnName(int j)
      Gets the display name for a column. The name is generated using the current column naming function.
      Parameters:
      j - the column number (0-based)
      Returns:
      the display name for the specified column

    • getCurrentColNum

      public int getCurrentColNum()
      Get the current column number.
      Returns:
      column number of the selected cell

    • setCurrentColNum

      public void setCurrentColNum(int colNum)
      Sets the current column number while maintaining the current row selection. This method is typically used for horizontal navigation in the sheet.
      Parameters:
      colNum - the column number to select (0-based). Negative values will be clamped to 0.

    • getCurrentRowNum

      public int getCurrentRowNum()
      Get the current row number.
      Returns:
      row number of the selected cell

    • getSheet

      public Sheet getSheet()
      Retrieves the current sheet associated with this view delegate.
      Returns:
      the currently loaded sheet

    • setCurrentRowNum

      public void setCurrentRowNum(int rowNum)
      Sets the current row number while maintaining the current column selection. This method is typically used for vertical navigation in the sheet.
      Parameters:
      rowNum - the row number to select (0-based). Negative values will be clamped to 0.

    • getGridColor

      public com.dua3.utility.data.Color getGridColor()
      Gets the color used for drawing grid lines in the sheet view. Grid lines separate cells visually in the sheet.
      Returns:
      the current color used for grid lines

    • setGridColor

      public void setGridColor(com.dua3.utility.data.Color gridColor)
      Sets the color to be used for drawing grid lines in the sheet view. This affects the visual appearance of cell boundaries. The method is thread-safe and uses a write lock to ensure proper synchronization.
      Parameters:
      gridColor - the new color for grid lines. Must not be null.

    • getRowName

      public String getRowName(int i)
      Gets the display name for a row. The name is generated using the current row naming function.
      Parameters:
      i - the row number (0-based)
      Returns:
      the display name for the specified row

    • setColumnNames

      public void setColumnNames(IntFunction<String> columnNames)
      Sets the function used to generate column names. This function is called to create display names for columns in the sheet view. The method is thread-safe and triggers a layout update since column names may affect the layout dimensions.
      Parameters:
      columnNames - a function that takes a column number (0-based) and returns the display name for that column. Must not be null.

    • setRowNames

      public void setRowNames(IntFunction<String> rowNames)
      Sets the function used to generate row names. This function is called to create display names for rows in the sheet view. The method is thread-safe and triggers a layout update since row names may affect the layout dimensions.
      Parameters:
      rowNames - a function that takes a row number (0-based) and returns the display name for that row. Must not be null.

    • getBackground

      public com.dua3.utility.data.Color getBackground()
      Gets the background color used for the sheet view. This color is used to fill the sheet's background area.
      Returns:
      the current background color

    • setBackground

      public void setBackground(com.dua3.utility.data.Color background)
      Sets the background color for the sheet view. This affects the appearance of the sheet's background area. The method is thread-safe and uses a write lock to ensure proper synchronization.
      Parameters:
      background - the new background color to use. Must not be null.

    • move

      public void move(Direction d)
      Moves the current cell selection in the specified direction, taking into account merged cells (spans). The movement is based on the logical cell, which represents the top-left cell of a merged region.
      Parameters:
      d - the direction to move (NORTH, SOUTH, EAST, or WEST)

    • getCurrentLogicalCell

      public Cell getCurrentLogicalCell()
      Gets the logical cell for the current selection. For merged cells, this returns the top-left cell of the merged region, which is considered the logical cell for the entire merged area.
      Returns:
      the logical cell representing the current selection. For non-merged cells, this is the same as the current cell. For merged cells, this is the top-left cell of the merged region.

    • setCurrentCell

      public boolean setCurrentCell(int i, int j)
      Sets the current (selected) cell using row and column indices.
      Parameters:
      i - the row index of the cell to select (0-based)
      j - the column index of the cell to select (0-based)
      Returns:
      true if the cell selection was changed, false if the specified cell was already selected or the indices were out of bounds

    • setCurrentCell

      public boolean setCurrentCell(Cell cell)
      Sets the current (selected) cell using a Cell object.
      Parameters:
      cell - the cell to select. Must be a cell from this sheet.
      Returns:
      true if the cell selection was changed, false if the specified cell was already selected or the cell was invalid (null or from a different sheet)

    • movePage

      public void movePage(Direction d)
      Moves the current cell selection by a page in the specified direction, taking into account merged cells (spans). The movement is based on the logical cell and considers the current view area.
      Parameters:
      d - the direction to move (NORTH, SOUTH, EAST, or WEST). The movement distance depends on the current view area and cell spans.

    • getCellRect

      public com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.Rectangle2f getCellRect(Cell cell)
      Calculate the rectangle the cell occupies on screen.
      Parameters:
      cell - the cell whose area is requested
      Returns:
      the rectangle the cell takes up in screen coordinates

    • moveEnd

      public void moveEnd()
      Moves the selection to the bottom-right cell of the sheet. This selects the cell at the intersection of the last row and last column that contain data.

    • moveHome

      public void moveHome()
      Moves the selection to the top-left cell of the sheet. This selects the cell at the intersection of the first row and first column that contain data.

    • onMousePressed

      public void onMousePressed(Cell cell)
      Handles mouse press events on a cell in the sheet. This method manages both cell selection and editing states:

      If clicking a different cell: 1. Sets the clicked cell as the current cell 2. If currently editing, stops the editing

      If clicking the current cell: 1. If the sheet is editable, starts editing the cell

      In all cases, the sheet view receives focus. The method logs the cell reference at trace level for debugging purposes.

      Parameters:
      cell - the cell that was clicked. Must be a cell from this sheet.

    • requestFocus

      public void requestFocus()
      Requests keyboard focus for this sheet view. This ensures that keyboard events (like typing or navigation keys) are directed to this sheet view. The actual focus request is delegated to the owner component through its focusView() method. The request is logged at trace level for debugging.

    • isEditing

      public boolean isEditing()
      Checks whether a cell is currently being edited. This indicates whether the sheet view is in cell editing mode, where the user can directly modify the content of the current cell.
      Returns:
      true if a cell is currently being edited, false otherwise

    • isEditable

      public boolean isEditable()
      Checks whether the sheet view allows editing of cell content. This setting controls whether users can modify cell values through the UI.
      Returns:
      true if editing is enabled, false if the sheet view is read-only

    • setEditable

      public void setEditable(boolean editable)
      Sets whether the sheet view allows editing of cell content. When editing is disabled, users cannot modify cell values through the UI. The method is thread-safe and uses a write lock to ensure proper synchronization.
      Parameters:
      editable - true to enable editing, false to make the sheet view read-only

    • setEditing

      public void setEditing(boolean editing)
      Sets the editing state of the sheet view. This method is called internally to manage the cell editing state. The method is thread-safe and uses a write lock to ensure proper synchronization.
      Parameters:
      editing - true to indicate that cell editing is in progress, false to indicate that editing has ended

    • getPaddingX

      public float getPaddingX()
      Gets the horizontal padding used for cell content layout. This padding is applied to both the left and right sides of cell content to prevent text from touching cell borders.
      Returns:
      horizontal padding in points (1/72 inch)

    • getPaddingY

      public float getPaddingY()
      Gets the vertical padding used for cell content layout. This padding is applied to both the top and bottom of cell content to prevent text from touching cell borders.
      Returns:
      vertical padding in points (1/72 inch)

    • getRowHeightInPixels

      public float getRowHeightInPixels(int rowNumber)
      Gets the height of a specific row in pixels, taking into account the current scale.
      Parameters:
      rowNumber - the row number (0-based)
      Returns:
      the height of the specified row in pixels

    • getRowHeightInPoints

      public float getRowHeightInPoints(int i)
      Gets the height of a specific row in points (1/72 inch). For rows within the sheet bounds, calculates the height as the difference between the start positions of the current and next row. For the last row or rows beyond the sheet bounds, returns the default row height.
      Parameters:
      i - the row number (0-based)
      Returns:
      the height of the specified row in points

    • getColumnWidthInPoints

      public float getColumnWidthInPoints(int j)
      Gets the width of a specific column in points (1/72 inch). The width is calculated as the difference between the start positions of the current column and the next column.
      Parameters:
      j - the column number (0-based)
      Returns:
      the width of the specified column in points

    • getLocale

      public Locale getLocale()
      Gets the locale used for formatting and displaying content in the sheet view. Delegates to the owner component's locale setting.
      Returns:
      the current locale used for text formatting and display

    • getLabelBorderWidthInPoints

      public float getLabelBorderWidthInPoints()
      Gets the width of label borders in points (1/72 inch). This is calculated by converting the pixel width using the current pixel-to-point ratio.
      Returns:
      the current border width in points

    • get1PxWidthInPoints

      public float get1PxWidthInPoints()
      Gets the width of one pixel in points (1/72 inch). This value is used for converting between pixel and point measurements.
      Returns:
      the width of one pixel in points

    • getTransformation

      public com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.AffineTransformation2f getTransformation()
      Gets the current transformation matrix used for coordinate conversions between the model and view space. Creates a new scale transformation based on the current scale settings.
      Returns:
      a new affine transformation representing the current scale

    • getScale

      public com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.Scale2f getScale()
      Gets the current scale factor applied to the sheet content. This scale determines how the sheet content is sized relative to its logical dimensions.
      Returns:
      the current scale factor for both horizontal and vertical dimensions

    • setScale

      public void setScale(com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.Scale2f scale)
      Sets the scale factor for the sheet content. This affects the size of all sheet elements including cells, text, and decorations. The method is thread-safe and triggers a layout update only if the scale actually changes.
      Parameters:
      scale - the new scale factor to apply. Must not be null.

    • getDefaultRowHeightInPixels

      public float getDefaultRowHeightInPixels()
      Gets the default height for rows in pixels. This value is used for new rows and for rows beyond the sheet bounds. Converts the point-based default height to pixels using the current pixel-to-point ratio.
      Returns:
      the default row height in pixels

    • get1PxHeightInPoints

      public float get1PxHeightInPoints()
      Gets the height of one pixel in points (1/72 inch). This value is used for converting between pixel and point measurements.
      Returns:
      the height of one pixel in points

    • getDefaultColumnWidthInPixels

      public float getDefaultColumnWidthInPixels()
      Gets the default width for columns in pixels. This value is used for new columns and for columns beyond the sheet bounds. Converts the point-based default width to pixels using the current pixel-to-point ratio.
      Returns:
      the default column width in pixels

    • getDisplayScale

      public com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.Scale2f getDisplayScale()
      Gets the current display scale factor applied to the sheet view. This scale affects how the sheet content is rendered on screen and is used for zooming operations.
      Returns:
      the current display scale factor

    • setDisplayScale

      public void setDisplayScale(com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.Scale2f displayScale)
      Sets the display scale factor for the sheet view. This scale is used to adjust the view for different display resolutions or zoom levels. Unlike setScale(), which affects the content size, this affects how the scaled content is displayed on the screen. The method is thread-safe and triggers a layout update only if the display scale actually changes.
      Parameters:
      displayScale - the new display scale factor to apply. Must not be null.

    • getTotalArea

      public com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.Rectangle2f getTotalArea()
      Returns the area taken up by the sheet and decorations in view coordinates. This includes the main sheet area, row headers (numbers), column headers (letters), and any split lines if the sheet is split.
      Returns:
      the total area used to display the sheet and its labels, in points

    • getColumnLabelHeightInPoints

      public float getColumnLabelHeightInPoints()
      Gets the height of column labels (column letters) in points (1/72 inch). This height is used to determine the size of the column header area in the sheet view. The height is constant in points but may vary in pixels depending on the current scale.
      Returns:
      the height of column labels in points

    • getRowLabelWidthInPoints

      public float getRowLabelWidthInPoints()
      Gets the width of row labels (row numbers) in points (1/72 inch). This width is used to determine the size of the row header area in the sheet view. The width is constant in points but may vary in pixels depending on the current scale.
      Returns:
      the width of row labels in points

    • drawLabel

      public void drawLabel(com.dua3.utility.ui.Graphics g, com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.Rectangle2f r, String text)
      Draws a label with text in the specified rectangle using the current label styling. The label includes: - A background filled with the label background color - A border with the label border color and specified width - Centered text using the label font
      Parameters:
      g - the graphics context to draw on
      r - the rectangle defining the boundaries of the label
      text - the text to be displayed in the label, centered both horizontally and vertically

    • getLabelBackgroundColor

      public com.dua3.utility.data.Color getLabelBackgroundColor()
      Gets the background color used for row and column labels.
      Returns:
      the current background color used for labels

    • getLabelBorderColor

      public com.dua3.utility.data.Color getLabelBorderColor()
      Gets the color used for drawing borders around row and column labels.
      Returns:
      the current color used for label borders

    • setLabelBorderColor

      public void setLabelBorderColor(com.dua3.utility.data.Color labelBorderColor)
      Sets the color to be used for drawing borders around row and column labels. This affects the visual appearance of the sheet's header areas.
      Parameters:
      labelBorderColor - the new color for label borders. Must not be null.

    • getLabelBorderWidthInPixels

      public float getLabelBorderWidthInPixels()
      Gets the width of label borders in pixels. This is the actual width used for rendering borders around row and column labels.
      Returns:
      the current border width in pixels

    • setLabelBorderWidthInPixels

      public void setLabelBorderWidthInPixels(float labelBorderWidthInPixels)
      Sets the width of label borders in pixels. This affects the visual appearance of borders around row and column labels.
      Parameters:
      labelBorderWidthInPixels - the new border width in pixels. Must be positive.

    • setLabelBackgroundColor

      public void setLabelBackgroundColor(com.dua3.utility.data.Color labelBackgroundColor)
      Sets the background color to be used for row and column labels. This affects the visual appearance of the sheet's header areas.
      Parameters:
      labelBackgroundColor - the new background color for labels. Must not be null.

    • getSheetArea

      public SheetView.SheetArea getSheetArea(com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.Rectangle2f r, boolean clipToSheet)
      Calculates the sheet area (range of rows and columns) that intersects with the given rectangle in the view coordinates.
      Parameters:
      r - the rectangle in view coordinates (points) to calculate the intersecting sheet area for
      clipToSheet - if true, the end row and column will be clipped to the sheet bounds; if false, the area may extend beyond the sheet's actual dimensions
      Returns:
      a SheetArea object containing the start/end row and column numbers that intersect with the given rectangle. Row and column numbers start at 0, and negative start values are clamped to 0. End values are exclusive (one past the last included row/column).

    • getSplitLineWidthInPoints

      public float getSplitLineWidthInPoints()
      Gets the width of the split line in points (1/72 inch). The split line is used to visually separate different panes when the sheet is split.
      Returns:
      the width of the split line in points, adjusted for the current horizontal scale

    • getSplitLineHeightInPoints

      public float getSplitLineHeightInPoints()
      Gets the height of the split line in points (1/72 inch). The split line is used to visually separate different panes when the sheet is split.
      Returns:
      the height of the split line in points, adjusted for the current vertical scale

    • getSplitXInPixels

      public double getSplitXInPixels()
      Gets the x-coordinate of the vertical split line in pixels. This is calculated as the sum of the row label width and the scaled position of the split column.
      Returns:
      the x-coordinate of the vertical split line in pixels

    • getRowLabelWidthInPixels

      public float getRowLabelWidthInPixels()
      Gets the width of row labels (row numbers) in pixels. This is the actual width used for rendering, calculated by applying the current scale to the point-based width. This value changes when the view is zoomed.
      Returns:
      the width of row labels in pixels, based on the current scale

    • getSplitYInPixels

      public double getSplitYInPixels()
      Gets the y-coordinate of the horizontal split line in pixels. This is calculated as the sum of the column label height and the scaled position of the split row.
      Returns:
      the y-coordinate of the horizontal split line in pixels

    • getColumnLabelHeightInPixels

      public float getColumnLabelHeightInPixels()
      Gets the height of column labels (column letters) in pixels. This is the actual height used for rendering, calculated by applying the current scale to the point-based height. This value changes when the view is zoomed.
      Returns:
      the height of column labels in pixels, based on the current scale

    • getSplitLineWidth

      public double getSplitLineWidth()
      Gets the width of the split line in device pixels. This is a constant value that determines the visual thickness of the vertical split line.
      Returns:
      the width of the split line in pixels

    • getSplitLineHeight

      public double getSplitLineHeight()
      Gets the height of the split line in device pixels. This is a constant value that determines the visual thickness of the horizontal split line.
      Returns:
      the height of the split line in pixels
